metadata.title: CVE-2023-32629 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
Local privilege escalation vulnerability in Ubuntu Kernels overlayfsovl_copy_up_meta_inode_data skip permission checks when callingovl_do_setxattr on Ubuntu kernels

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32629` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-155-generic - 5.4.0-155.172~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-155.172~18.04.1').
